support_summary: TDP-43 directly binds to the 3'-UTR of the neurofilament light chain (NFL) mRNA, which increases the stability of the transcript.

functions.function: NEFL mRNA Stability and Axonal Transport
functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 binds to UG-rich sequences in the 3' untranslated region (UTR) of the neurofilament light (NEFL) mRNA.
functions.effect_description: This binding stabilizes the NEFL transcript and promotes its transport into axons within mRNP granules. TDP-43's presence in these granules influences their movement, favoring anterograde (outward) transport.
biological_consequence: TDP-43 binds NEFL mRNA → Increased mRNA stability and packaging into granules → Anterograde transport into axons → Localized NEFL protein synthesis → Maintenance of axonal cytoskeleton
specific_effects: Loss of TDP-43 function can lead to reduced stability and mislocalization of NEFL mRNA, impairing cytoskeletal integrity.
TDP-43-containing NEFL mRNP granules move predominantly in the anterograde direction.

evidence.paper_title: Characterizing the RNA targets and position-dependent splicing regulation by TDP-43

mechanism: TDP-43 binds to UG-rich sequences in the 3' untranslated region (UTR) of the neurofilament light (NEFL) mRNA.
effect: This binding stabilizes the NEFL transcript and promotes its transport into axons within mRNP granules. TDP-43's presence in these granules influences their movement, favoring anterograde (outward) transport.
summary: TDP43 activates NEFL to modulate nefl mrna stability and axonal transport, ultimately affecting maintenance of axonal cytoskeleton.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 in ALS: Stay on target… Almost there
Characterizing the RNA targets and position-dependent splicing regulation by TDP-43
